comment.text: I absolutely love this place! Tonight was our first time trying this place out - and absolutely incredible. Also I did not take picture of the smores they have but OMGGGGG they were amazing!! Loved it.

My teammates and I came here for a dinner during a workshop we were attending. 

Location: If you are staying near the Fox Theater, it's a quick 5-7 minute walk to the restaurant, inside is decorated so cute! 

Parking: We walked from our hotel 

Service: we made reservations for a party of 11 had and only waited 2-5 minutes before being sat, our server was great and organized.

Ambience/Crowd: young old ratchet bougie 
Food/drink : 8/10 I would give a 10 because everyone's entrees were delicious and the scallops are absolutely perfection but the guac was only ok. 

Favorite thing: scallops by far
Least favorite thing: guacamole 
Will I be back? And Why - YES FOR THE SCALLOPS

Wow... Simply amazing, had the carne asada with a roasted corn pudding and it was simply excellent. Loved the flavor profiles and how they all balanced themselves into one coherent dish.

The only negative is that I did get to try more of their menu items... I'll just have to come back I guess lol

I had family in town and wanted to take them somewhere nice for brunch since we both love Mexican food, I decided on El Valle. From the pictures, it looked really nice, and it looks exactly like that in person, very beautiful decor and paintings and was spacious as well.

Upon entering, it was dead (in their defense, it was rainy outside), but we were greeted with the smile sat at a beautiful table of our choosing. Shortly after we were then greeted by our waiter, who was great with us even spoke a little Spanish so that was a plus. 

To start, I ordered the bottomless, passionfruit mimosas. One of the things that made me choose. This restaurant was the fact they used a Mexican sparkling brut. It was delicious!

My dining companion did not want an appetizer, so since I was starving I just got the sopa de maíz. It had the consistency of a chowder it was sweet but still good, I think it would've been better with another ingredient, perhaps chicken or something.

For our main brunch meals, I got the pescado sarandeado. Hey, seared salmon on the bed of poblano grits, with creamy tomato sauce, and Mexican chimichurri. I don't care for grits, but my meal was absolutely delicious. The salmon was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was impeccable! The person I was dining with got the mole de ajo negro- braised short rib on top of a corn mash. I thought the taste was okay but then again, I'm not a huge fan of mole. My dining companion liked it but, said there was too much fat and was still hungry when we left lol. This is a more upscale restaurant so the portions are palm sized she probably should've got an appetizer after all.

photos.caption: The brut used for the mimosas

comment.text: The ambiance is absolutely great. Very comfortable booths, the decor looks great and the bar is large and fully stocked. The food is very well prepared. Some traditional Latin flavors with a twist but nothing that takes away from the traditions of the culture. The octopus was cooked to perfection, the sopes were good but the meat needed to be either shredded or cut into smaller chucks to eat, and the sopes themselves needed to be a bit firmer. But still very flavorful. The ceviche was fresh and delicious. The scallops were huge and cooked just right. I would definitely recommend this place. We walked past after our showing at the Fox and I believe they have Spanish music to dance as it gets late.

If you haven't already do yourself a favor and try this restaurant out. I must admit I was hesitant initially trying this place out cause it use to be a chill Mexican spot. Now a bit more upscale, the atmosphere upon entering is so sleek and sexy, definitely a good "date night spot". They offer a different variety of things but I would highly recommend the carne asada paired with the brussels sprouts, you WONT be disappointed. I would also recommend a drink from their scratch bar from no one other than bartender "Cocktail Papi" don't get me wrong the other bartenders are great, but Papi is an experience. This place exceeded my expectations so much. Since going I find myself here at least twice a week. Service is great, host are friendly, no long waits. Overall I would definitely recommend giving this place a try, trust me you won't be disappointed.

Hmmm went there on a wednesday night.  Nice vibes.  Live music.  The space is beautiful.  This is my third time and unfortunately each time is not as good as the last time.

It started out with a watered down cocktail which was disappointing - it was basically a margarita with mezcal.  This is easy for a mexican restaurant to get right.  But they make it again and it was better.

Now the food - 
halibut with pasta - the dish sounded better than it tasted.  This is something best ordered at an Italian restaurant instead of a Mexican one.  Nothing special.
Short rib mole dish - it was ok
mushroom side - again ok

El Valle is a contemporary Spanish restaurant, that specializes In Mexican cuisine. They are located off Peachtree Rd, in the heart of Midtown, near the Fox Theater. El Valle serves crafted cocktails with an Electric vibe. El Valle, classy Ambiance has a modern feel by welcoming a diverse crowd. El Valle has a small patio outside. Inside a beautiful living room space with a beautiful crowd of people. The bar area is nice and clean with comfortable bar chairs. I've been going to El Valle for over 12 months & the consistency with food, cocktails & service always fantastic. This stylish Mexican restaurant can be your one stop shop for a night out on the town. They have a DJ on weekends & regular live music throughout the week. El Valle is a good place for mingling, friend's meetup, birthday celebrations & brunch.  Their food is delicious! My favorite go-to dish is the Herb Guacamole, Tostada De Pulpo (octopus) & Tacos de Pescado flavored with spices complimenting your palate. I've gone on Friday nights with friends & Saturday's for Brunch. El Valle, parking is located in the back. This place gets really busy, get there early and Thank me later.

*FOOD*  I ordered the Tacos De Pollo (Chicken Tacos) and Elote-Style Corn Pudding to eat. The chicken tacos were moist, and they had a great classic flavor. The table wasn't a big fan of the Corn Pudding, though - we were expecting something closer to street corn. The pudding is more of a corn bread with corn in it topped with mayo and Tajin. 

*DRINKS* I ordered a Spicy Margarita and an Espresso Martini. The margarita was different than the classic style I was craving, but was still good. The martini was coffee-forward, which is my preference over a cream base. Some friends at my table got their staple Suave cocktail, and it was great. I'm not a huge fan of mezcal, but I was wishing I ordered it after trying it. 

*SERVICE*  Our server knew the menu like the back of his hand. Definitely felt like service at a more upscale spot without the white tablecloth price tag. 

*AMBIANCE*  I like the vibes of this spot for dinner or cocktails. They have some smaller cocktail tables in the bar area, which is really nice if you just want to pop in for drinks and not have to get a table for dinner. This spot turns into a club vibe at a certain time, so we came back later in the night to see what it was about. They had a DJ and were open until 3 am on the Saturday we went. Will definitely be returning on a classy night out.

I came to El Valle for a dinner on a Friday night and thought it was fine. I'd definitely try it again but I'm not jumping to go back.

I was able to get a same-day reservation on a Friday night, so that was nice, but the restaurant felt crowded when we arrived -- likely due to a show at The Fox. Service was pretty slow with it taking at least 5min before our server stopped by and then lots of time between other check-ins. We weren't in a rush so we didn't mind, and she did warn us that we wouldn't make it to the show in time if we were trying to get to that. The restaurant was pretty loud, so it was hard to hold a conversation at times, and the outdoor space seems nice and quieter but it's right along the sidewalk. I noticed diners getting interrupted by folks walking by and the street noise can sometimes be loud.

To eat, I had the soft shell crab appetizer and Brussels sprouts. The softshell crab was a bit small, but it was crispy and tasted good -- it could have had a bit more seasoning especially given the blandness of polenta, but it wasn't bad. The Brussels sprouts were very good -- crispy and nicely seasoned. I'd definitely get the Brussels sprouts again if I were to return. The cocktails were tasty and had some unique flavors, but they were overpriced.
I was good. Not my favorite  I believe you need an acquired taste for this place and  may not have the palate but the service was pleasant. We sat at the bar. The girl was sweet

photos.caption: Small dinner before St. Marks Christmas concert

comment.text:
SERVICE*
Placing this up top because it's such a huge disappointment. I was in town for a conference and found this place on Yelp, up the street from our hotel. 

Carlos was our server this past Sat (8/27/23) evening, and he didn't even try to accommodate the simple request. I wanted to try the tacos. I was willing to pay for the 3 chicken tacos and substitute one for cauliflower. You get 3 tacos. Two of the options were either chicken or cauliflower. I wanted 2 chicken and 1 cauliflower. I asked to substitute and stated I would pay the higher price, which is chicken, and without him even inquiring, he quickly said no. I even stated again you could charge me for the chicken substitute one of the cauliflower. Again, he just said no. Isn't that unbelievable?!!! And just simply ridiculous!  

Such a cute spot. However, when I return to ATL again, I will not be returning. I'm not sure how that score is so high. The food was bland, too. Please see below. 


FOOD **/.75
Callo de Acha con risotto de chorizo (seared scallops and risotto). What I ended up ordering since I couldn't get the tacos as requested above. I had to add the green sauce to enjoy the meal. No flavor. Extremely bland on both scallops and risotto. 

Tacos de pollo (chicken tacos) ***/.5
Without the sauce, 3 stars, and with the sauce 4 stars, so 3.5
Chicken isn't seasoned or barely where it tasted bland as well. What my dad ordered. He said the green sauce made it more enjoyable. 

Stars 1 + 2.5 + 3.5 = Average of 2.42

Diego was a phenomenal server! We were on the waitlist before Hamilton and was seated in about 5 minutes. The restaurant was very busy but the host, Jade, worked very hard to get us seated quickly. Food was amazing, we got the ceviche, shrimp tacos, mac and cheese, and the scallops entree. I loved the vibe of the restaurant. I recommend it to anyone looking for a restaurant before a show at the Fox Theater.

I visited El Valle for dinner on a Tuesday evening, party of 3.

I made reservations in advance but only a day or so in advance.  

Our group absolutely enjoyed this dinner and our drinks.

We ordered the octopus, soft shell crab, ceviche, pork tostada,  Brussels sprouts and finished with the deconstructed s'mores.  

All was fantastic, the Brussels Sprouts and the Ceviche are stand out item.  

Try the wine from Mexico, this wine pictures below is a new favorite.

Service was good but we communicated a peanut allergy and the server did not tell us when nuts were in a item we ordered.  We had to ask after the item was received and it turned out the item had nuts...

AMAZING Mexican restaurant where everything (food, drinks, service) is done right!! The food and cocktails were TOP NOTCH and the vibe and ambience set the stage for an awesome dinner. We tried several of the happy hour small plates (guacamole, Mac n cheese, shrimp taco, beef brisket taco) and the scallops with risotto! 10 out of 10! Camilo was an excellent bartender and we enjoyed the energy of the bar and watching as he made each outgoing drink (I had the sangria) with care and pizazz! We will definitely be returning when we are in Atlanta!!

What a great spot!  I passed them on my walk down Peachtree and they had music and dancing in the front.  Coming back at night, we stopped in for a cocktail.  We both had the Ava Maria, vodka, watermelon cordial, and orange liqueur...soooooooo good!  I love the interior!  I also loved the front bar with seats on both sides.  This would be a great way to still watch the people walking by.  We didn't have any food, just drinks.  The bartenders were all very friendly!  I'd love to come back for lunch or dinner the next time I'm in town!
This is a nice Mexican cocktail bar. You get full service at the bar. Cocktails are good, bartender is really nice and attractive. Great music and atmosphere. I would definitely recommend it.
Food was great! Decor and service was great! I'll be back! Parking could be a little complicated.

Not a huge fan of traditional Mexican food, so I absolutely loved El Valle! It was a nice twist on Mexican food with plenty of yummy options. 

I got the chicken stuffed with mushrooms..this was my favorite dish that I have had in a while! It looked like bread when it first came out lol, but I ate every last bite. The sauce with it was the perfect pairing. 

I got a beautiful drink that was strong!! The bartender was amazing, never let me go a second without another round. 

The atmosphere was on point! We sat at the bar, but there were tables and a lounge space where you could sit and eat. There is parking in the back and you don't have to pay, you just have to tell the hostess your license plate number and you are good there until they give you a time.

Great upscale Mexican restaurant in ATL. High quality drinks and has a unique menu. They incorporated a lot of high quality seafood in their menu like scallops, soft shell crab and octopus which nothing I've experienced before at a Mexican restaurant. I definitely recommend. Ambiance is beautiful and service was quick and attentive.

Mexican cuisine with an upscale flare, yet casual environment. Easy online reservations. Service was top notch from being greeted at the door to our server. Drinks were good as we had mocktails. Good variety drink menu and wine selection. Not too little, yet not overbearing. Ambiance is nice with a section for the bar separate from dining along with a lounge area for what I could imagine for happy hour or drinks before a show at the Fox or chatting with friends. Our meal was also delicious with a chicken and pork dish. Easy parking in back with validation.

photos.caption: Mac n cheese with sausage and pork rind crumbles.

comment.text:
Exceeded all expectations! Food was over the top, impeccable service . If you are seeing a show at The Fox this should be a number one choice. Easy walking distance 
.

Had dinner at El valle on a Saturday evening, the food was great!! Definitely exceeded my expectations. The ambience was perfect & cocktails amazing. Stayed for the live Latin DJ and had so much fun dancing! 
10/10 recommend

If you are looking for superb service, exquisite food, reasonable prices and excellent drinks, this is the place for you!  This is my favorite eatery in Atlanta. Formerly EL Scorpion, this newly reimagined space is perfect for brunch AND dinner. I've been here three times since they have opened and each experience gets better than the last.  

I always opt to be seated on the front patio so I can people watch which is always entertaining lol. The patios are covered and temperature controlled. now parking (literally the determining factor for dining downtown): they have a lot directly behind the building which if free for three hours if you dine at the restaurant.  You don't need a ticket; just give the hostess your license plate and they will take care of the rest. There is also street parking parallel to the building.

I've been here for brunch, dinner and one occasion both lol. I could literally spend all day here just trying everything off the menu. But I will give you my top eats.

Brunch:
CARNITAS HASH - flavor town!! cooked to perfection and just absolutely one of the best breakfast hash I've ever had!

TRES LECHE FRENCH TOAST - The toppings tend to change due to the season but I had the tropical one and the French toast was two pieces of buttery goodness with a thinly sliced camrelized banana in the middle topped with chantilly cream! If you prefer sweet meals for brunch, this is it.

SMOKED SALMON TOSTADA - think the best smoked salmon bagel but make it Mexican lol truly delicious! I wish this was on their dinner menu as an appetizer. 

Dinner:
HALIBUT CEVICHE- I've never had ceviche with Halibut, so I was pleasantly surprised and instantly addicted lol I order that every time I go here now as my app.

BRANZINO - This was my first time having branzino and I can say this is the true star of the dinner menu. It's wrapped in a Hoja Santa Leaf and definitely sets the bar first with presentation but completely follows through with flavor. This is my favorite thing on the menu! The serving is definitely on the smaller size but I still fully enjoy it!

DESSERT
HORCHATA PANNA COTTA - If you have room left, I HIGHLY recommend the panda cotta. I've had panda cottas before, and in my opinion are very hard to perfect with flavor. I never had a horchata so I was intrigued and it paid off lol. This is my favorite dessert item. I love it!!

Honorable mention goes to deconstructed s'mores. Nothing super special about it besides the presentation is nice and its a perfect share item for the table.

They also have an amazing wine list especially the roses! They also have mimosa carafes starting at $45 during brunch on Sundays.

Wowowow, a true get in Midtown. Upon entering, I immediately loved the vibes. It is dimly lit, very cute and sexy vibes. Perfect for a first date, date night, or just catching up with the girls. They are open late which is nice, and if you're lucky...there is a parking lot right behind the building in which they validate! The parking lot might be a little tricky to find if you don't know what you're looking for. If you're coming down Peachtree and the restaurant is on your right, there will be a little opening right before you get to the corner with the red light.

Everyone was so accommodating, so helpful, and so nice. there is a little outside seating, there is a dining room area, a bar, and even a lounge. The lounge area is filled with couches and low tables, so it might be hard to eat a meal there, but nevertheless, super cute and perfect for a date situation.

I ordered the chips and guacamole and the chicken tacos. I can tell that everything was made with high-quality items, and nothing lacked flavor. Our waitress was so helpful in providing recommendations, especially for the drinks. I ended up ordering the Labios Rotos and I was kinda nervous about it because I've had similar drinks at different places that weren't that tasty. However, I trusted the waitress and went with it. Great choice if you enjoy a strong, but tasty drink!

I'm going to check out some of their events during the week. I'll definitely be back.

The ambiance was amazing 
Looked swanky with black and white photos of Mexico
The service was subpar 
A lot of
Miscommunication with the waitress and a long wait of 15 minutes before water 
The  drinks were pretty good esp the margarita but the food  was very disappointing  with the scallops and rice, the chicken fried , the chicken tacos ( a bit on the salty side) , and the cauliflower tacos 
All in all , we are not sure we would return but for drinks /happy hour

Went to dinner here last night. Overall I would say it was good. The Brussels sprouts were delicious! Definitely recommend those. My husband said the fish taco were just ok, not amazing but also not terrible. I loved the scallops but the polenta was way to spicy for me. My husband even tried it and he likes spicy food and said it was really spicy so just be careful if spice is not your life lol I would say the service was just average. We waited quite a while for the bill and it wasn't even busy so that was slightly annoying. Probably won't be back but it was worth trying once.
Really good food, the service was great and live music it a welcome addition for Midtown's restaurants. I will recommend it to anyone looking to enjoy light Mexican cuisine in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Modern Mexican Cuisine with live music on Saturday 10:30PM-1:30AM

comment.text:
El Valle is a great place to have dinner before a show at the Fox.  It's located only a few walkable blocks away from the theater.  The interior of the restaurant is modern and clean.  

We sat in the dining room but you have the option to sit on the outside patio, the lounge or at a high top. 

The food was delicious! We ordered the halibut ceviche which was beautifully plated, the sopa de maiz, the tacos de pescado and the sopes de carnitas. The corn soup was creamy with a slight heat from the poblano peppers and you could taste really pieces of corn.  The sopes had great flavor and the pork belly was perfectly cooked.  The sopes themselves were tough to cut through and made it difficult to eat without lots of effort.  

Overall we enjoyed the experience and would return again in the future.

Perfection. 

Arrived with modest expectations of a decent meal. Was blown away. The drinks, service and food were all excellent. Our server, Jade, really helped make the experience special. 

The good:
- inspired cocktails 
- blackened salmon on poblano grits
- deconstructed s'mores 
- fabulous service 
- food delivered quickly 

The bad:
- nothing--check it out!

We were trying to get to Dallas but our airline put us in Atlanta for an evening. My daughter's boyfriend lives here because Atlanta was where he found his employment. He picked us up from the airport and took us here. This is a great place. We sat at the bar and enjoyed cocktails and munched on the ceviche and delicious skirt steak. The vibe here is wonderful. Mellow but vibrant. If you find yourself in Atlanta from Philly trying to get to Dallas, I highly recommend. But truly, I recommend it regardless.

We have been wanting to check out this spot for a while now. We had early reservations on a Saturday night for dinner. 
The Resy app is quick and easy and also sends reminders. 
Parking took a second so we had to loop around the restaurant and park before it came up on the right. 
We were greeted immediately and  seated immediately.
We had the guacamole as the appetizer and got the fish and chicken tacos as well as the scallops with risotto, carne asada and a side of poblano Mac and cheese.
Everything was beautifully presented and very flavorful. Also great for us to share. 
Highly recommend! 
We also had some great cocktails! The martinis and mojitos are both amazing!!

MOUTHWATERING FOOD. okay how do I begin? 

Drinks: mocktails are plenty and I love that. I love that there are mocktail versions of their traditional cocktails. I think I had the Mariposa Traicionera and another one with a beautiful flower inside. Both were refreshing. 

Appetizers: Corn soup is smooth and flavorful. 

Food: 
Sope de camarón are Exquisite. 
 Huevos Rancheros were everything you'd hope they would be and more. 
French Toast (not pictured because I devoured it) A MUST HAVE IF YOU EAT HERE. We had it as a dessert and even though I was full I couldn't stop eating this amazing dish. 

Service: 10/5 stars because there was never a moment that we felt we weren't being given attention. The servers are kind, knowledgeable of the menu and friendly. 

Parking: suggest you validate with the host when you come in. Give them the tag # of your car. 

Overall PLEASE visit this location if you're in town.

The food and service was really good but it was really pricey. Also, the happy hour is only available at the bar which we did not know about in advance. This would be a good place to go if you were traveling to Atlanta for a work trip but I don't think it's worth the price for a local.

My friends and I came to El Valle on a Friday night for dinner. The aesthetic is clean and the food gives elevated Mexican. I really enjoyed my experience here! The restaurant was easy to find and they have a conveniently located parking deck right behind the building.

This is that place you'll want to take your friends for some razzle dazzle cocktails in their life. The drinks here are so good, they **almost** outshine the food. I always go for the Piel Canela, which consists of Saint Theresa Rum, Cacao Liquor, Gifford Banana, and Scrappy's Chocolate Bitters. It's creamy and tastes like an ice cream sundae if you're into that kind of drinking experience. For spice lovers, they have the Suave: Banhe Mezcal, Agave, Poblano Pepper, and Lime. I have to take a moment to brag on the presentation too - some of their cocktails also come with edible flowers. And the drinks are strong too, so I'd suggest taking an Uber or Lyft. 

As for the menu options, I can't get enough of the Halibut Ceviche and the Tostada de Pulpo.  Their food is fresh and light, and you won't walk away feeling uncomfortably full. The staff is also extremely personable and courteous, it's some of the best services I've had in Atlanta! El Valle is innovative, it's upscale without being pretentious, and I'm probably going there this weekend ;)
Food was fantastic and the staff were incredibly welcoming. Cool spot to stop in for a drink at their bar or a dinner at a table. They accommodated a group of 12 for us and everything was great!

This little gem has all the Ambiance of a 5 star restaurant but reasonably priced happy hour menu. They have some delicious authentic Mexican entrees that are must try's . If you are tequila lover then this is your place . Friendly bar and wait staff if you are solo dining. My only complaint is sometimes the entrees aren't constantly delicious so I can't give them 4 stars but this place is a must try!!'

Loved it! So glad a restaurant nearby closed early due to "understaffing" (that just means they don't pay enough to keep employees) and recommended this place. 

Perfect fish tacos, a great portion and delicious flavors. Really great cheesy sweet potatoes. And a ridiculously delightful cocktail, the Bonita y Mentirosa. 

Very attentive and friendly staff. Definitely will be back next time I'm in town. 

NOTE: the kitchen closes earlier than the bar does, so double check if you're coming late for food.

photos.caption: Fish tacos, sweet potatoes, Bonita y mentirosa

comment.text: This is THE spot. No question. You'll love the bartenders, food, and drinks. 100% worth the stop. Carlos, Jen, and Fae will make you feel right at home. The ambiance is just a bonus
Great spot for brunch! The whole environment is such a great vibe - the food,  drinks, music, and service was wonderful. Will be coming back for dinner sometime!

Free parking in the back of the building 
Paid parking on the street, but free on Sunday's.


I really wanted to like this place because it is so beautiful but I left a little underwhelmed. I ordered the pulpo for an appetizer and it was extremely over cooked. I love charred octopus so this was a little disappointing. 
For an entree, I order the scallops and chorizo risotto. The scallops were amazing but something was missing with the risotto, it was very chewy and oily. You can see from the picture how the food was sitting in a bed of oil. I know chorizo is oily by nature but I was not expecting this presentation

A Night to Remember at El Valle! 

Hey friends! I just had the most incredible fine dining experience at El Valle, and I couldn't wait to share it with all of you! 

From the moment I stepped into this high-end restaurant, I was blown away by the elegant ambiance and the warm, welcoming staff. The attention to detail was impeccable, and it truly felt like stepping into a world of luxury and indulgence. 

Now, let's talk about the food!  Every dish that graced our table was a masterpiece, thanks to the mastermind behind the menu, Luis. His culinary expertise and creativity shone through, leaving us in awe of his talent. And let's not forget about the amazing cocktails crafted by Alex, the magnificent bartender. Each sip was a burst of flavor and perfectly complemented our meal. 

The menu at El Valle is a true celebration. From the succulent scallops to the tender, melt-in-your-mouth steak appetizer, every dish was crafted with utmost care and expertise by Luis. And Alex's innovative cocktail creations added an extra touch of magic to our evening. 

But it wasn't just the food and drinks that made this evening unforgettable. The service was top-notch, with the staff, including Luis, going above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. The knowledge and passion for the craft were evident in every interaction, making us feel like royalty throughout the night. 

Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking to treat yourself, El Valle is the place to be. The combination of exceptional food, elegant atmosphere, and outstanding service, creates an experience that will leave you with memories to cherish forever.

So, if you're ready to embark on a culinary journey like no other, make sure to visit El Valle and experience the magic. Trust me, you won't be disappointed! 

#ElValle #FineDiningExperience #LuxuryIndulgence #CulinaryMasterpieces #UnforgettableEvening #LuisTheMastermind

This restaurant is very nice..High class, elegant
the service is fantastic...and the food absolutely delicious.....The Carnitas Tacos were delicious..and my favorite dessert ofcourse...The figgy pudding with ice cream...you must order it..Absolutely Devine
I highly recommend El Valle and Pescado a la Veracruzana. It is a great location for an intimate dinner. They also have brunch on Sunday! Mr. Abbas and the staff are great!

Great experience! We went on a Tuesday at 4:30 pm, right when they opened. We were the first ones to walk through the door. Service was fantastic; we were given the happy hour menu. We ordered: guac, mussels (I don't like mussels so didn't try these), the burger, crispy taquitos, and mac & cheese. I've had better mac & cheese-- it was a little cold and the taste was okay. But gotta say, the taquitos from the happy hour menu we're fantastic. Really liked them. Cocktails were also fun and the furniture set-up is neat, too. Very modern-looking. I want to come back and try other items from the menu next time.

**Also: if you stress out about parking, like I do, know you can validate parking to have it be free for three hours. We stayed over three hours because it was such a cool vibe.

photos.caption: No Culpes a la Noche cocktail

comment.text:
The absolute perfect spot to grab drinks and dinner for date night or a girls night, and such a convenient stop before catching a show at The Fox. 
This restaurant recently opened in Midtown and has the cutest interior and so much bar seating! They offer contemporary Mexican food that does not disappoint. 
All of the food & cocktails were amazing and it was seriously the best location! We ate here for dinner and walked to a show at The Fox; it was literally a 3 minute walk to the theatre AND they validate parking for 2 hours.
We got the Ceviche, guac, cauliflower tacos, chicken tacos, and the Brussels sprouts- it was all delicious. I am obsessed with the ceviche- literally the best ceviche I've ever had! And the guac was amazing too. I want to come back and try everything else including their Mexican wines!

I only gave this place an extra star because it has a great look. Very chic.
The food is another story. For the money, the quality is not there. Pitiful. Service was so so. Won't be back and it's a shame because I live in the neighborhood.

The ambiance is sooo freakin adorable that I'm in love with all things ElValle. A group of coworkers walked a few blocks to one amazing lunch find on Peachtree. The food is everything and great portions. Tacos de pescado, herb guacamole with the best chips, and the Brussels are also a must order. Sparkling water or just water and the server was very attentive to our large party. I went back the next day for dinner, dinner post up next.
Dinner the next day was served by MJ. She was very attentive and noticed the table was a little rocky and got down on her knees to adjust the legs to resolve the issue without hesitation. I opted for the chicken tacos and herb guacamole and we shared the ceviche. We opted to dine outside on the patio which was great weather but was disturbed by our city's urban camper who wanted money. The cocktail presentation cute and taste was on point. All my guest that ask for restaurant finds in the area will be guided to MJ and ElValle every time I'm asked hands down. Birthday dinner party will be booked here

El Valle is my new favorite restaurant in Midtown. The atmosphere is beautiful, the service is excellent, and the food is delicious! I've visited this establishment on several occasions and they don't disappoint. Everything they do and provide is thoughtful and intentional. 

The food is fresh and tasty -- a few favorites include: pulpo, halibut ceviche, carne asada, ensalada col risada... and the horchata panna cotta!! 

Emphasis on live music throughout the week is also a huge plus! Oh and did I mention the daily weekday happy hour. 

Whether you're out for drinks with friends, a romantic date, or just want to sit at the bar for a bite, this place can accommodate.
